digitalTwins.description: EN,Festo OVEL Vacuum generator;DE,Festo OVEL Vakuumsaugdüse

digitalTwinsModels.description: Administrative metainformation for an element like version information.

contents.name: version
contents.description: Version of the element.

contents.name: revision
contents.description: Revision of the element.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Element that can be extended by proprietary extensions. Abstract interface

contents.name: extensions
contents.description: An extension of the element.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An element that is referable by its idShort. This id is not globally unique. This id is unique within the name space of the element.

contents.name: idShort
contents.description: In case of identifiables this attribute is a short name of the element. In case of referable this id is an identifying string of the element within its name space.

contents.name: displayName
contents.description: Display name. Can be provided in several languages.

contents.name: category
contents.description: The category is a value that gives further meta information w.r.t. to the class of the element. It affects the expected existence of attributes and the applicability of constraints.

contents.name: description
contents.description: Description or comments on the element. The description can be provided in several languages.

digitalTwinsModels.description: The value of a qualifiable element may be further qualified by one or more qualifiers or complex formulas.

contents.name: qualifier
contents.description: Additional qualification of a qualifiable element.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An element with a kind is an element that can either represent a template or an instance.

contents.name: kind
contents.description: Kind of the element: either type or instance

enumValues.name: Template
enumValues.description: Software element which specifies the common attributes shared by all instances of the template.

enumValues.name: Instance
enumValues.description: Concrete, clearly identifiable component of a certain template.

digitalTwinsModels.comment: Attention: Due to DTDL v2 limitations of max 2 extends for an interface, the remaining 3 superinterfaces from the AAS specification were inlined

contents.name: kind
contents.description: An element with a kind is an element that can either represent a template or an instance.
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasKind to reduce number of extended interfaces

contents.name: semanticId
contents.description: Identifier of the semantic definition of the element. It is called semantic id of the element.
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasSemantics to reduce number of extended interfaces

contents.name: dataSpecification
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasDataSpecification to reduce number of extended interfaces

digitalTwinsModels.description: A data element is a submodel element that is not further composed out of other submodel elements. A data element is a submodel element that has a value. The type of value differs for different subtypes of data elements.
A relationship element is used to define a relationship between two referable elements

contents.name: first
contents.description: Reference to the first element in the relationship taking the role of the subject.

contents.name: second
contents.description: Reference to the second element in the relationship taking the role of the subject.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An annotated relationship element is a relationship element that can be annotated with additional data elements.

contents.name: annotation
contents.description: A reference to a data element that represents an annotation that holds for the relationship between the two elements.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Used to uniquely identify an entity by using an identifier.

contents.name: idType
contents.description: Type of the Identifier, e.g. IRI, IRDI etc. The supported Identifier types are defined in the enumeration “IdentifierType

schema.description: IdentifierType - Enumeration of different types of Identifiers for global identification

enumValues.name: IRDI
enumValues.description: IRDI according to ISO29002-5 as an Identifier scheme for properties and classifications.

enumValues.name: IRI
enumValues.description: IRI according to Rfc 3987. Every URI is an IRI.

enumValues.name: Custom
enumValues.description: Custom identifiers like GUIDs (globally unique identifiers)

contents.name: id
contents.description: Globally unique identifier of the element

digitalTwinsModels.description: An identifiable element is a referable with a globally unique identifier (Identifier). To reference an identifiable only the global id (identification/id) shall be used because the idShort is not unique for an identifiable. Identifiables may have administrative information like version etc

contents.name: administration
contents.description: Administrative information of an identifiable element.

contents.name: identification
contents.description: The globally unique identification of the element.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Element that can be extended by using data specification templates. A data specification template defines a named set of additional attributes an element may or shall have. The data specifications used are explicitly specified with their global id.
An Asset describes meta data of an asset that is represented by an AAS and is identical for all AAS representing this asset.The asset has a globally unique identifier

contents.name: derivedFrom
contents.description: The reference to the AAS the AAS was derived from.

contents.name: security
contents.description: Definition of the security relevant aspects of the AAS

contents.name: assetInformation
contents.description: Meta information about the asset the AAS is representing

contents.name: submodel
contents.description: Reference to a submodel of the AAS. A submodel is a description of an aspect of the asset the AAS is representing. The asset of an AAS is typically described by one or more submodels. Temporarily no submodel might be assigned to the AAS.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Enumeration for denoting whether an element is a type or an instance. To be used as component in other interfaces

enumValues.name: Type
enumValues.description: hardware or software element which specifies the common attributes shared by all instances of the type[SOURCE: IEC TR 62390:2005-01, 3.1.25]

enumValues.name: Instance
enumValues.description: concrete, clearly identifiable component of a certain type

digitalTwinsModels.description: In AssetInformation identifying meta data of the asset that is represented by an AAS is defined. The asset may either represent an asset type or an asset instance.

contents.name: assetKind
contents.description: Denotes whether the Asset is of kind “Type” or “Instance”.

contents.name: globalAssetId
contents.description: Reference to either an Asset object or a global reference to the asset the AAS is representing.

contents.name: globalAssetRef
contents.description: Reference to either an Asset object or a global reference to the asset the AAS is representing.

contents.name: specificAssetId
contents.description: Additional domain specific specific, typically proprietary Identifier for the asset like e.g. serial number etc

contents.name: billOfMaterial
contents.description: A reference to a Submodel that defines the bill of material of the asset represented by the AAS. This submodel contains a set of entities describing the material used to compose the composite I4.0 Componen

contents.name: defaultThumbnail
contents.description: Thumbnail of the asset represented by the asset administration shell. Used as default.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Reference to either a model element of the same or another AAs or to an external entity. A reference is an ordered list of keys, each key referencing an element. The complete list of keys may for example be concatenated to a path that then gives unique access to an element or entity.

contents.name: key
contents.description: Unique reference in its name space.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Element that can have a semantic definition. Abstract interface

contents.name: semanticId
contents.description: Identifier of the semantic definition of the element. It is called semantic id of the element.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An IdentifierKeyValuePair describes a generic identifier as key-value pair.

contents.name: key
contents.description: Key of the identifier

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value of the identifier with the corresponding key.

contents.name: externalSubjectId
contents.description: The (external) subject the key belongs to or has meaning to

digitalTwinsModels.description: A File is a data element that represents an address to a file. The value is an URI that can represent an absolute or relative path.

contents.name: value
contents.description: Path and name of the referenced file (with file extension). The path can be absolute or relative.

contents.name: mimeType
contents.description: Mime type of the content of the file. The mime type states which file extensions the file can have

digitalTwinsModels.description: An event
A basic event.

contents.name: observed
contents.description: Reference to a referable, e.g. a data element or a submodel, that is being observed

digitalTwinsModels.description: Blob Data Element

contents.name: value
contents.description: Blob Type.

contents.name: mimeType
contents.description: mimeType

digitalTwinsModels.description: A capability is the implementation-independent description of the potential of an asset to achieve a certain effect in the physical or virtual world.

The semantics of a property or other elements that may have a semantic description is defined by a concept description. The description of the concept should follow a standardized schema (realized as data specificationtemplate).

contents.name: isCaseOf
contents.description: Reference to an external definition the concept is compatible to or was derived from.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A constraint is used to further qualify or restrict an element. Abstract interface
A set of value reference pairs.

contents.name: valueReferencePairType
contents.description: A pair of a value together with its global unique id

digitalTwinsModels.description: Content of data specification template for concept descriptions conformant to IEC 61360. Although the IEC61360 attributes listed in this template are defined for properties and values and value lists only it is also possible to use the template for other definition

contents.name: unitId
contents.description: Unique unit id

contents.name: definition
contents.description: Definition in different languages

contents.name: valueList
contents.description: List of allowed values

contents.name: valueId
contents.description: Unique value id

contents.name: levelType
contents.description: Set of levels

digitalTwinsModels.description: An entity is a submodel element that is used to model entities

contents.name: statement
contents.description: Describes statements applicable to the entity by a set of submodel elements, typically with a qualified value.

contents.name: entityType
contents.description: Describes whether the entity is a comanaged entity or a self-managed entity.

enumValues.name: CoManagedEntity
enumValues.description: For co-managed entities there is no separate AAS. Co-managed entities need to be part of a self-managed entity.

enumValues.name: SelfManagedEntity
enumValues.description: Self-Managed Entities have their own AAS but can be part of the bill of material of a composite self-managed entity.

contents.name: globalAssetId
contents.description: Reference to the asset the entity is representing.

contents.name: specificAssetId
contents.description: Additional domain specific specific, typically proprietary Identifier for the asset like e.g. serial number etc

digitalTwinsModels.description: Defines the necessary information for sending or receiving events

contents.name: observableReference
contents.description: Reference to the Referable, which defines the scope of the event. Can be AAS, Submodel, SubmodelElementCollection or SubmodelElement

contents.name: state
contents.description: State information

contents.name: messageTopic
contents.description: nformation for the outer message infrastructure for scheduling the event to the respective communication channel.

contents.name: messageBroker
contents.description: Information, which outer message infrastructure shall handle messages for the EventElement. Refers to a Submodel, SubmodelElementCollection, which contains  DataElements describing the proprietary specification for the message broker

contents.name: lastUpdate
contents.description: Timestamp in UTC, when the last event was received (input direction) or sent (output direction).

contents.name: minInterval
contents.description: For input direction, reports on the maximum frequency, the software entity behind the respective Referable can handle input events. For output events, specifies the maximum frequency of outputting this event to an outer infrastructure. Might be not specified, that is, there is no minimum interval

contents.name: maxInterval
contents.description: For input direction, reports on the maximum frequency, the software entity behind the respective Referable can handle input events. For output events, specifies the maximum frequency of outputting this event to an outer infrastructure. Might be not specified, that is, there is no minimum interval

digitalTwinsModels.description: Defines the necessary information of an event instance sent out or received

contents.name: source
contents.description: Reference to the source EventElement, including identification of AAS, Submodel, SubmodelElements.

contents.name: sourceSemanticId
contents.description: semanticId of the source EventElement, if available

contents.name: observableReference
contents.description: Reference to the Referable, which defines the scope of the event. Can be AAS, Submodel, SubmodelElementCollection or SubmodelElement.

contents.name: observableSemanticId
contents.description: semanticId of the Referable, which defines the scope of the event, if available. See above

contents.name: topic
contents.description: Information for the outer message infrastructure for scheduling the event to the respective communication channel.

contents.name: subject
contents.description: ABAC-Subject, who/ which initiated the creation

contents.name: timestamp
contents.description: Timestamp in UTC, when this event was triggered.

contents.name: payload
contents.description: Event specific payload. Detailed in annex.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Single extension of an element

contents.name: name
contents.description: An extension of the element.  Constraint AASd-077: The name of an extension within HasExtensions needs to be unique.

contents.name: valueType
contents.description: Type of the value of the extension.

contents.name: value
contents.description: Value of the extension

contents.name: refersTo
contents.description: Reference to an element the extension refers to.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A formula is used to describe constraints by a logical expression.

contents.name: dependsOn
contents.description: A formula may depend on referable or even external global elements that are used in the logical expression. The value of the referenced elements needs to be accessible so that it can be evaluated in the formula to true or false in the
contents.comment: To refer to an external global element use the property 'externalRef'

digitalTwinsModels.description: A key is a reference to an element by its id

contents.name: key
contents.description: Denote which kind of entity is referenced. In case type = GlobalReference then the key represents a global unique id.

schema.description: Enumeration of different key value types within a key

enumValues.name: GlobalReference
enumValues.description: reference to an element not belonging to an asset administration shell

enumValues.name: FragmentReference
enumValues.description: unique reference to an element within a file. The file itself is assumed to be part of an asset administration shell.

enumValues.name: AccessPermissionRule
enumValues.description: Access Permission Rule

enumValues.name: Range
enumValues.description: Range with min and max

contents.name: value
contents.description: The key value, for example an IRDI if the idType = IRDI.

contents.name: idType
contents.description: Type of the key value.

enumValues.name: IdShort
enumValues.description: idShort of a referable element

enumValues.name: FragmentId
enumValues.description: Identifier of a fragment within a file

enumValues.name: IRDI
enumValues.description: IRDI according to ISO29002-5 as an Identifier scheme for properties and classifications.

enumValues.name: IRI
enumValues.description: IRI according to Rfc 3987. Every URI is an IRI.

enumValues.name: Custom
enumValues.description: Custom identifiers like GUIDs (globally unique identifiers)

digitalTwinsModels.comment: A property is a data element that has a multi-language value

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value of the property instance.

contents.name: valueId
contents.description: Reference to the global unique id of a coded value.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An operation variable is a submodel element that is used as input or output variable of an operation

contents.name: value
contents.description: Describes the needed argument for an operation via a submodel element of kind=Template.

digitalTwinsModels.description: An operation is a submodel element with input and output variables

contents.name: inputVariable
contents.description: Input parameter of the operation.

contents.name: outputVariable
contents.description: Output parameter of the operation.

contents.name: inoutputVariable
contents.description: Parameter that is input and output of the operation.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A property is a data element that has a single value.

contents.name: valueType
contents.description: Data type of the value

contents.name: value
contents.description: The value of the property instance.

contents.name: valueId
contents.description: Reference to the global unique id of a coded value.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A qualifier is a type-value-pair that makes additional statements w.r.t. the value of the element.

contents.name: type
contents.description: The qualifier type describes the type of the qualifier that is applied to the element.

contents.name: valueType
contents.description: Data type of the qualifier value.

contents.name: value
contents.description: The qualifier value is the value of the qualifier

contents.name: valueId
contents.description: Reference to the global unique id of a coded value.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A range data element is a data element that defines a range with min and max.

contents.name: valueType
contents.description: Data type of the min und max

contents.name: min
contents.description: The minimum value of the range

contents.name: max
contents.description: The maximum value of the range

digitalTwinsModels.description: A reference element is a data element that defines a logical reference to another element within the same or another AAS or a reference to an external object or entity.

contents.name: value
contents.description: Reference to any other referable element of the same of any other AAS or a reference to an external object or entity

contents.name: value
contents.description: Submodel element contained in the collection.

contents.name: ordered
contents.description: If ordered=false, then the elements in the collection are not ordered. If ordered=true, then the elements in the collection are ordered.

contents.name: allowDuplicates
contents.description: If allowDuplicates==true, then it is allowed that the collection contains several elements with the same semantics (i.e. the same semanticId).

digitalTwinsModels.description: A value reference pair within a value list. Each value has a global unique id defining its semantic

contents.name: value
contents.description: the value of the referenced concept definition of the value in valueId.

contents.name: valueId
contents.description: Global unique id of the value.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A view is a collection of referable elements w.r.t. to a specific viewpoint of one or more stakeholders
digitalTwinsModels.comment: Attention: Due to DTDL v2 limitations of max 2 extends for an interface, the remaining superinterface HasSemantics from the AAS specification was inlined

contents.name: semanticId
contents.description: Identifier of the semantic definition of the element. It is called semantic id of the element.
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasSemantics to reduce number of extended interfaces

contents.name: containedElement
contents.description: Reference to a referable element that is contained in the view.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Table that defines access permissions per authenticated subject for a set of objects (referable elements).

contents.name: targetSubjectAttributes
contents.description: Target subject attributes that need to be fulfilled by the accessing subject to get the permissions defined by this rule.

contents.name: permissionsPerObject
contents.description: Target subject attributes that need to be fulfilled by the accessing subject to get the permissions defined by this rule.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Access Control defines the local access control policy administration point.

contents.name: accessPermissionRule
contents.description: Access permission rules of the AAS describing the rights assigned to

contents.name: selectableSubjectAttributes
contents.description: authenticated subjects that are configured for the AAS. They are selectable by the access permission rules to assign permissions to the       subjects

contents.name: defaultSubjectAttributes
contents.description: Reference to a submodel defining the default subjects’ attributes for the AAS that can be used to describe access permission rules

contents.name: selectablePermissions
contents.description: Reference to a submodel defining which permissions can be assigned to the subjects

contents.name: defaultPermissions
contents.description: Reference to a submodel defining which permissions can be assigned to the subjects

contents.name: selectableEnvironmentAttributes
contents.description: Reference to a submodel defining which environment attributes can be accessed via the permission rules defined for the AAS, i.e. attributes that are not describing the asset itself.

contents.name: defaultEnvironmentAttributes
contents.description: Reference to a submodel defining default environment attributes, i.e. attributes that are  not describing the asset itself.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Definition of a security policy administration point (PAP).

contents.name: localAccessControl
contents.description: The policy administration point of access control as realized by the AAS itself.

contents.name: externalAccessControl
contents.description: Tf externalAccessControl True then an Endpoint to an external access control defining a policy administration point to be used by the AAS needs to be configured.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Defines the security policy decision points (PDP)

contents.name: externalPolicyDecisionPoints
contents.description: If externalPolicyDecisionPoints True then Endpoints to external available decision points taking into consideration for access control for the AAS need to be configured

digitalTwinsModels.description: Defines the security policy enforcement points (PEP).

contents.name: externalPolicyEnforcementPoint
contents.description: If externalPolicyEnforcementPoint True then an Endpoint to external available enforcement point taking needs to be configured for the AAS

digitalTwinsModels.description: Defines the security policy information points (PIP)

contents.name: externalInformationPoints
contents.description: If externalInformationPoints True then at least one Endpoint to external available information needs to be configured for the AAS.

contents.name: internalInformationPoint
contents.description: Reference to a Submodel defining information used by security access permission rules.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Container for access control policy points.

contents.name: policyAdministrationPoint
contents.description: The access control administration policy point of the AAS.

contents.name: policyDecisionPoint
contents.description: The access control policy decision point of the AAS.

contents.name: policyEnforcementPoint
contents.description: The access control policy enforcement point of the AAS.

contents.name: policyInformationPoints
contents.description: The access control policy information points of the AAS.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A set of data elements that further classifies a specific subject

contents.name: subjectAttribute
contents.description: A data element that further classifies a specific subject.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Table that defines access permissions for a specified object. The object is any referable element in the AAS. Additionally, object attributes can be defined that further specify the kind of object the permissions apply to

contents.name: object
contents.description: Element to which permission shall be assigned.

contents.name: targetObjectAttributes
contents.description: Target object attributes that need to be fulfilled so that the access permissions apply to the accessing subject.

contents.name: permission
contents.description: Permissions assigned to the object.

digitalTwinsModels.description: X509 Certificate.

contents.name: policyAdministrationPoint
contents.description: The access control administration policy point of the AAS.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Certificate provided as BLOB.

contents.name: blobCertificate
contents.description: Certificate as BLOB.

contents.name: containedExtension
contents.description: Extensions contained in the certificate.

contents.name: lastCertificate
contents.description: Denotes whether this certificate is the certificated that fast added last.

digitalTwinsModels.description: A set of data elements that describe object attributes. These attributes need to refer to a data element within an existing submodel

contents.name: objectAttribute
contents.description: Reference to a data element that further classifies an object.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Description of a single permission.

contents.name: permission
contents.description: Reference to a property that defines the semantics of the permission

contents.name: kindOfPermission
contents.description: Description of the kind of permission. Possible kind of permission also include the denial of the permission.

enumValues.name: Allow
enumValues.description: Allow the permission given to the subject.

enumValues.name: Deny
enumValues.description: Explicitly deny the permission given to the subject.

enumValues.name: NotApplicable
enumValues.description: The permission is not applicable to the subject.

enumValues.name: Undefined
enumValues.description: Explicitly deny the permission given to the subject.

digitalTwinsModels.description: Container for security relevant information of the AAS.

contents.name: accessControlPolicyPoints
contents.description: Access control policy points of the AAS.

contents.name: certificate
contents.description: Authentificating Certificates of the AAS and its submodels etc.

contents.name: requiredCertificateExtension
contents.description: Certificate extensions as required by the AAS

digitalTwinsModels.comment: Attention: Due to DTDL v2 limitations of max 2 extends for an interface, the remaining 3 superinterfaces from the AAS specification were inlined

contents.name: submodelElement
contents.description: A submodel consists of zero or more submodel elements.

contents.name: kind
contents.description: An element with a kind is an element that can either represent a template or an instance.
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasKind to reduce number of extended interfaces

contents.name: semanticId
contents.description: Identifier of the semantic definition of the element. It is called semantic id of the element.
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasSemantics to reduce number of extended interfaces

contents.name: dataSpecification
contents.comment: Attention: Inlined from interface HasDataSpecification to reduce number of extended interfaces
